title: 114_s585
content: The "American Natural Gas Security and Consumer Protection Act" authorizes the exportation of natural gas. The Natural Gas Act is amended to authorize the importation of natural gas, with provisions for the Commission to issue orders and modify regulations. Prohibitions on exporting natural gas from the United States are also addressed. The Natural Gas Act is amended to authorize the exportation of natural gas from the United States to foreign countries. A person must obtain an order from the Secretary of Energy before exporting natural gas, and the Secretary may issue an order if it is determined to be in the public interest. The Secretary of Energy can modify and grant export applications for natural gas, subject to final regulations. Public interest determination includes NEPA review. The Secretary of Energy must issue a detailed statement on the environmental impact of exporting natural gas, including an analysis on the impact of extraction on local communities. Final regulations for issuing export orders must be established within 2 years of enactment. The Secretary of Energy must assess the public interest of exporting natural gas by considering current and projected demands, production, and prices in the United States. The Secretary of Energy must assess the public interest of exporting natural gas by considering the effects on household and business energy expenditures, the economy, jobs, and manufacturing of the United States. The Secretary of Energy evaluates the energy security of the United States, including reducing reliance on imported oil, conserving domestic natural gas supplies, and exploring natural gas use in transportation and industry. The curr_chunk discusses the impact on various sectors in the United States, including transportation, industrial, and electricity, as well as the ability to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, national security, foreign policy, domestic natural gas supply, availability, trade balance. The curr_chunk discusses exemptions for natural gas exports, including requirements under part B of title II of the Energy Act. The Secretary of Energy may issue orders without modification or delay under certain acts, including part B of title II of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, section 203 of the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, and section 5(b) of the Trading with the Enemy Act. SEC. 3. EFFECT. This Act does not impact the authority under the Natural Gas Act regarding the importation or exportation of natural gas to nations with free trade agreements.
